meanings.sent1: He walked backwards to see what was behind him.
meanings.sent2: She tripped and fell backwards on the grass.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to walk backwards but ended up looking silly.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed backwards, defying gravity.
meanings.sent5: The idea of time moving backwards fascinated him.

meanings.definition: In a reverse or opposite direction
meanings.sent1: The car drove backwards down the one-way street.
meanings.sent2: She rewound the tape backwards to listen to the song again.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit hop backwards out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: The clock's hands spun backwards, confusing everyone.
meanings.sent5: The map was read backwards, leading them astray.

meanings.definition: In a way that is contrary to the usual or expected way
meanings.sent1: He thought backwards, starting from the end and working towards the beginning.
meanings.sent2: She wore her shirt backwards by accident.
meanings.sent3: The teacher wrote the answer backwards on the board for fun.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle was solved backwards, beginning with the last piece.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked backwards, causing confusion among the students.
